node.title: 'Wellness warriors' and misinformation blamed for vaccine lag in wealthy suburbs
node.alt: Primo Bentivegna wearing a black shirt, standing towards the camera with a computer screen behind him to the left.
node.description: Some of Melbourne's richest areas are among the least vaccinated in Victoria, figures show, with the trend leaving local doctors concerned about what is to come.
node.content:
["Patients from Primo Bentivegna's medical clinic in Malvern East were largely spared when COVID-19 spread across Melbourne this year.", "But in recent weeks, Dr Bentivegna says that has started to change.", "What is also concerning, the experienced GP says, is an emergence of COVID-positive patients asking him for vaccine exemptions.", "Dr Bentivegna's clinic is located in the City of Stonnington, the richest local government area in Victoria, which includes the suburbs of Toorak, South Yarra and Prahran.", "It is also an area that appears to have fallen behind most of Victoria in terms of COVID-19 vaccinations. According to Federal Government figures from Monday, Stonnington's first-dose rates ranked 75th out of 79 Victorian council areas.", "
Natural COVID immunity 'weak and short-lived'
", "Dr Bentivegna said his staff had received at least 10 exemption requests from people who were suffering from the virus.", "While some wrongly thought they would have a \"natural immunity\" against COVID-19 for an extended period, others were adamant they did not want a vaccine at all.", "\"I think there's a component of fear and misinformation. I'm also seeing a cohort of people that don't seem to like being told what to do, which is unfortunate,\" Dr Bentivegna said.", "\"The current guidelines say that you should receive the vaccine as soon as you're well enough.\"", "Under Victoria's current rules, an exemption or proof of full vaccination is required to work in many industries, enter restaurants and even attend large indoor gatherings.", "GPs can secure exemptions for patients by filling out a form that is submitted to the Australian Immunisation Register.", "Permanent exemptions can be granted for people who have suffered anaphylaxis from previous COVID-19 vaccine doses.", "A six-month exemption can also be issued to people with acute symptoms of \"long COVID\", or to those with an \"acute major medical condition\", such as recovery in hospital from major surgery.", "Nearly all underlying medical conditions and anxiety about getting a vaccine are not valid reasons for exemptions.", "", "
Vaccination rates in the council area of Port Phillip are also lagging well behind the state average.(AAP: James Ross)
", "Monday's data showed 81.1 per cent of Stonnington residents had received one vaccine dose, while 76.3 per cent were double-jabbed.", "On the same day, Victoria's first dose rate was sitting at 91.8 per cent, and its second at 80.7 per cent.", "It is a similar story in the neighbouring City of Port Phillip \u2014 Victoria's second-wealthiest area \u2014 where vaccine rates are about 2 per cent worse than in Stonnington.", "
'Wellness warriors' reluctant to get vaccinated
", "Associate professor Margie Danchin, an immunisation and vaccine uptake expert, said there could be several reasons why traditionally well-off areas appear to have fallen behind.", "Dr Danchin said some younger people were yet to be convinced that vaccines were safe, and blamed misinformation that had spread through some community groups.", "", "
Dr Danchin says some have turned against vaccines because they have misinterpreted scientific information.\u00a0(ABC News: Kristian Silva)
", "\"There's also a group \u2014 particularly in some of the more inner-city areas \u2014 that we call the 'wellness warriors',\" she said.", "Dr Danchin said vaccine campaigns targeted at specific groups were now needed.", "She believes authorities need\u00a0to do more to understand why there has\u00a0been reluctance by some to take the vaccine.", "\"Amongst potentially more-educated adults \u2026 they often need a bit more convincing about the science or they may have misinterpreted the science around the vaccines,\" Dr Danchin said.", "Dr Danchin's previous research has also shown childhood vaccination rates were lower in some of Melbourne's wealthiest suburbs, including those in the likes of Stonnington and Port Phillip.", "Across the state, 56 council areas have recorded first-dose rates greater than 95 per cent. That includes Hume and Wyndham, areas that suffered large outbreaks and initially trailed in the vaccine rollout process.", "The local government areas of Yarra and Melbourne rank as the state's least-vaccinated areas, with about a 75 per cent first-dose uptake, the federal figures show.", "However, City of Melbourne officials believe their true vaccination rates are substantially higher, because the population data used by the federal government is from 2019 and did not take into account the large exodus of international students from the CBD during the pandemic.", "Lord Mayor Sally Capp said international students had made up a third of the CBD's population before the pandemic, and possibly less than half remained now.", "Dr Bentivegna and Dr Danchin are concerned about what could play out in the coming months if parts of Melbourne fail to reach 90 per cent double-dose vaccine rates against COVID-19.", "The state's intensive care unit beds are already filling up, and Health Minister Martin Foley has admitted\u00a0the hospital system is\u00a0\"under huge pressure from COVID-19\".", "On Friday, the state's biggest virus hotspot, Casey, had 1,960 active cases of COVID-19.\u00a0There were only 91 active cases in Stonnington.", "But even those numbers were high enough to scare Dr Bentivegna, who is a board member of the Australian Society of General Practice.", "\"Each one of those can infect 10, 100 people. It tells me we're out of control, even in this area,\" he said.", "\"The question people have to ask themselves is, do you want to be protected when you get the infection? Or do you want to go in without any protection?\"", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
